business.headline: Sensex settles 573 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 573.38 points to end at 81,118.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 169.60 points to close at 24,718.60.

Gold prices rise sharply amid Israel-Iran tensions in IndiaThe rise in gold prices is being linked to worries over a possible wider conflict in the Middle East, which has made investors turn to gold as a safe place to park money.

Oswal Pumps opens Rs 1,387 crore IPO with strong brokerage backingOswal Pumps targets Rs 1,387.34 crore from IPO. Experts recommend subscribing due to strong fundamentals. IPO open until June 17, 2025.

Air India crash rattles hotel and ticketing stocks, as investor confidence waversOnline travel companies were among the most affected. Shares of Thomas Cook India fell by 2.39%, trading at Rs 160.03 as of June 13, 1PM. TBO Tek dropped 1.10% to Rs 1,287.40, while Mahindra Holidays slipped 1.47% to Rs 342.35.

Air India crash: How airline insurance works and why premiums may riseIncidents like the recent Air India crash can result in a total loss, meaning the aircraft is beyond repair with no salvageable parts. In such cases, the losses can reach around $130 million, roughly $80 million for the plane and $30-50 million in liabilities.

Who are the likely insurers for Air India plane crash?The plane involved in the crash was a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, one of the most modern aircraft used in commercial aviation. It was carrying 242 people, including 12 crew members.

Boeing's revival on trial after deadly Air India Dreamliner crash in AhmedabadThe fatal crash of Air India flight AI-171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad, has killed 241 people on board, reigniting serious doubts over Boeing's aircraft safety and corporate oversight.

Oil shock hits Dalal Street: BPCL, ONGC, IOC, other crude-sensitive stocks fallBrent crude oil futures jumped more than 9% to touch around $75.61 per barrel, reaching a multi-month high. The gain came after Israel said it had launched what it called "preemptive strikes" against Iran.

RBI steps in to contain fallout of oil price jump on rupee: ReportThe Indian rupee dropped to 86.20 against the US dollar in early trade but later recovered to 86.04, helped by the central bank's likely intervention.

Aviation stocks tumble after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadSpiceJet's share price dropped 3.42% at the start of the trading session. InterGlobe Aviation Ltd, the company that runs IndiGo, also fell 4.83%, slipping to Rs 5,212 in early trade.
Sensex, Nifty crash as Israel attacks Iran; oil prices jump sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 838.78 points to 80,853.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 252.80 points to 24,635.40 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex falls over 1,100 points. Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was down 1121.35 points to 80,570.63 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 334.65 points to trade at 24,553.55.

entertainment.headline: Chatha Pacha: Roshan Mathew's WWE-inspired Malayalam wrestling film beginsDirected by debutant Adhvaith Nayar, the wrestling film titled 'Chatha Pacha' stars Roshan Mathew, Arjun Ashokan, Vishak Nair and Ishan Shaukath in lead roles.

Materialists review: This romance glitters, but fades like perfume in windReleased-Fri Jun 13, 2025'Materialists' works well when it shows a flawed, ambitious, beautiful woman just trying to live her best life. But, what she preaches, and the choices she makes, especially when it comes to men, doesn't really seem right. Also, how does a romantic film work in the absence of good intimate scenes, especially when you have such pretty faces leading the story?

Munawar Faruqui hangs out with newlyweds Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal on show setsActors Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal met comedian Munawar Faruqui on the sets of their upcoming show, 'Pati Patni Aur Panga.' They were seen spending quality time on the sets of the show.

Alia Bhatt, Sharvari to feature in special dance track for action film Alpha: ReportActors Alia Bhatt and Sharvari are working hard on a special dance song for their new action film 'Alpha'. The movie will release in theatres during Christmas 2025 and also stars Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol.

Sussanne Khan grateful and blessed to have Hrithik Roshan as co-parentSussanne Khan reflected on co-parenting with actor Hrithik Roshan, shedding light on their commitment to providing a nurturing environment for their sons.

Prabhas's The Raja Saab teaser leaked, makers warn of strict actionWith just three days to go for the official teaser release of Prabhas' 'The Raja Saab', a few visuals and a short clip from the film were leaked online, prompting the makers to issue a firm warning against the circulation of leaked content.

Rana Naidu 2 review: Strong family drama, but familiar stereotypes in average showReleased-Fri Jun 13, 2025Rana Naidu 2 review: 'Rana Naidu 2', starring Rana Daggubati in the titular role, is streaming on Netflix. Does the crime-thriller live up to expectations?

Vir Das backs Air India after crash, calls them best crew in the skyOn Thursday, Vir Das lent his support to Air India, stating that he stands with them. This came following the crash of its London-bound flight AI171 in Ahmedabad.

Alia Bhatt's childhood pic with Paresh Rawal goes viral, fans link it to Tamanna setsAlia Bhatt's childhood photo with Paresh Rawal has gone viral, sparking nostalgia among fans. One of the social media users pointed out that the picture might be from the sets of 'Tamanna' (1997).

Kajol admits saying no to many successful films, including Aamir Khan's 3 idiotsActor Kajol shared she has declined many successful films, including Aamir Khan-starrer '3 idiots'. The actor said she does not regret saying no and has done very well for herself.

Superman final trailer: DC begins new era with David Corenswet as Man of SteelThe final trailer of James Gunn's 'Superman' has landed, introducing David Corenswet as DC's new Superman. It is set to hit the theatres on July 11, 2025.

Edagaiye Apaghatakke Karana review: Diganth's film is a quirky entertainerReleased-Fri Jun 13, 2025Edagaiye Apaghatakke Karana movie review: Directed by debutant Samarth Kadkol, this Kannada black comedy-suspense drama stars Diganth, Nidhi Subbaiah and Dhanu Harsha in the lead. With good comedy and interesting plot twists, the movie shines with Diganth as the crown jewel.

ATEEZ's new launch Lemon Drop has fans melting. WatchATEEZ has returned with their bold and sultry summer track Lemon Drop, captivating fans with a fresh, grown-up vibe. The music video and song together highlight the group's confident and charismatic new era.

The Traitors review: Bigg Boss meets Roadies in Karan Johar's luxe reality showReleased-Thu Jun 12, 2025Karan Johar-hosted show 'The Traitors' is now streaming on Prime Video. The reality show, with an impressive lineup of 20 celebrities, is a power play of vicious betrayals, cold-hearted deception, and constant manipulations. Read our review.

BTS RM's emotional letter on band's 12th anniversary moves fans to tearsBTS commemorated their 12th anniversary with leader RM sharing an emotional letter expressing gratitude and disbelief. Fans across were touched by his heartfelt words celebrating the group's journey.

How Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya helped recover stolen war hero's Mahavir ChakraActors Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya helped recover and return the stolen Mahavir Chakra medal of 1965 war hero, Squadron Leader AB Devayya. The medal was handed back to his family in a special ceremony held by the Indian Air Force in Bengaluru.

Mountain of sadness: Anupam Kher, Priyanka Chopra condole Air India plane crashActors Anupam Kher and Priyanka Chopra mourned the loss of lives in the Air India plane crash on Thursday afternoon. Anupam expressed the plane was not just a machine but a moving hope in which our loved ones were sitting.

South Korean actor Kim Soo-hyun loses apartment after missing penalty paymentActor Kim Soo-hyun failed to pay a penalty fee for one of his luxury apartments, a day after winning a court order to seize Kim Se Ui's properties over the Kim Sae Ron scandal fallout.

BTS' J-hope's Killin' It Girl is the empowerment anthem we've been waiting forJ-hope returns with his infectious solo Killin' It Girl, blending pop and hip-hop with a powerful message of self-love. Featuring GloRilla, the track and its vibrant visuals celebrate confidence and independence, making it a summer anthem.

general news.headline: He came to fulfil his wife's dying wish. Then he boarded doomed Air India flightLondon resident Arjun Patolia, a father of two, had travelled to India to scatter his late wife's ashes in River Narmada in Gujarat.

Live: Search on for black box of crashed Air India plane in AhmedabadAir India Ahmedabad-London Flight Crash Live: At least 265 people died in Ahmedabad after a London-bound Air India plane crashed into a government-run medical hostel moments after taking off from the city airport on Wednesday. The airline confirmed that the flight carried 242 passengers and there was only one survivor, who was seated on 11A. It also said that a digital video recorder was found, but a search was on to find the black box after earlier reports suggested that it had been discovered. Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Ahmedabad earlier today and took stock of the situation. Stay with Indiatoday.in for live updates.

How I survived: Vishwas Kumar, on seat 11A, recounts miracle escape from crashVishwash Kumar Ramesh was in seat 11A of the doomed Air India flight. After the plane crashed and exploded, he was the only person pulled out alive from the wreckage.

Israel hits Iran's nuke sites, Army chief killed; Tehran retaliates with 100 drones  Live UpdatesIsrael on Friday launched preemptive strikes on Iran, which the nation called Operation Rising Lion, and said was necessary to wade off the nuclear threat from Tehran's side. Meanwhile, Iran has vowed retaliation and after the strikes killed several, including Iran's Revolutionary Guards Commander Hossein Salami.

One was to quit, another just started: Tale of two pilots of Air India crashWhile Captain Sumeet Sabharwal was days away from quitting flying, First Officer Clive Kunder was just starting his career in the skies. Both the pilots commanding the Air India Dreamliner died when their aircraft crashed in Ahmedabad, killing all, but one, on board.

England tour: Coach Gautam Gambhir returns to India due to family emergencyIndian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir has returned to India from England due to a family emergency. India and England are set to lock horns in a five-match Test series beginning from June 20.

Air India crash was 1000°C inferno: How can the black box and DVR survive it?Despite such extreme conditions, the hunt is on to retrieve the black box, pointing to the advanced material engineering that allows these devices to survive catastrophic events.

PM visits Air India crash site; bodies of 5 victims handed over to familiesAir India Flight AI171 bound for London crashed moments after taking off from Ahmedabad airport, killing at least 265 people in what authorities described as the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade.

When a Pak fighter jet shot down Gujarat CM's plane 60 years agoSixty years before former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani lost his life in the Air India crash on Thursday, a sitting Gujarat CM was lost mid-air, not to malfunction, but to a Pakistani strike. During the India-Pakistan War of 1965, a Pakistani fighter shot down Balwantrai Mehta's Beechcraft aircraft, perceiving it as to be a surveillance aircraft.

Was never loved like Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal: Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic has claimed that he was never loved like Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal during their playing days and felt like the third guy in tennis. Djokovic shared legendary rivalries with both Federer and Nadal.

Will quit flying to care for you, father: Air India Pilot's promise days before crashCaptain Sumeet Sabharwal, the seasoned Air India pilot who was killed in the tragic crash in Ahmedabad, had promised his ailing father he would quit flying to care for him.

20-year-old student, newly engaged couple among those killed in Air India crashOut of the 242 people on board, 241 were killed in the disaster. The lone survivor, Vishwash Kumar Ramesh is presently undergoing treatment.

The Traitors review: Bigg Boss meets Roadies in Karan Johar's luxe reality showReleased-Thu Jun 12, 2025Karan Johar-hosted show 'The Traitors' is now streaming on Prime Video. The reality show, with an impressive lineup of 20 celebrities, is a power play of vicious betrayals, cold-hearted deception, and constant manipulations. Read our review.

Bomb scare forces emergency landing of Delhi-bound Air India flight in ThailandAn Air India flight from Thailand's Phuket to Delhi made an emergency landing shortly after takeoff on Friday following a bomb threat, which was found to be a hoax after preliminary examination.

Day after Air India crash, hunt begins for black box: Why it's importantA black box in an aeroplane records flight and voice data. It's key in crash investigations, helping experts understand what went wrong and how to avoid it in future.

Shubhanshu Shukla's launch delayed six times: Here are the reasonsThe mission, which would mark India's return to human spaceflight after 41 years, was rescheduled for June 11, 2025, but now faces an indefinite delay.
Bandhani meets Nike in a first-of-its-kind collaborationSportswear giant Nike has collaborated with Indian label NorBlack NorWhite for a limited-edition collection.
Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband Sunjay Kapur dies of heart attack at 53 Actor Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, Sanjay Kapur, died of a heart attack in England. He was 53.

Video: PM Modi meets Air India plane crash lone survivor at Ahmedabad hospitalPM Modi visits the Civil Hospital in Ahmedabad and meets the lone survivor, Vishwash Kumar Ramesh, of the Air India plane crash and other people injured in the accident.  In the plane crash, 265 people lost their lives. He was accompanied by Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel.

Building on fire, thick smoke, rubble: Horrific visuals of Israeli attack on IranIsrael launched strikes on Tehran on Friday, targeting key nuclear and military sites and killing top commanders, sparking fears of a full-scale war with Iran.

Vir Das backs Air India after crash, calls them best crew in the skyOn Thursday, Vir Das lent his support to Air India, stating that he stands with them. This came following the crash of its London-bound flight AI171 in Ahmedabad.
Explained: What is Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau and what does it do?This government agency works to find the cause of air accidents and make flying safer for everyone.

At least 16 Air India flights diverted due to Iran airspace closure after Israel strikeSeveral Air India flights were diverted or forced to return to their origin airports after Iran closed its airspace following a major Israeli strike on Tehran.

Early monsoon arrival expected in Delhi, 10 days before scheduleTypically, the monsoon arrives in Delhi around June 30, but an India Meteorological Department (IMD) report suggests it could make its presence felt as early as the third week of June.

sports.headline: Team India pay tribute to Air India crash victims, Lord's observes minute of silenceTeam India paid their tributes to the victims of the Air India crash ahead of their intra-squad game in Beckenham on Friday, June 13. The World Test Championship Final Day 3 action also got underway after a minute of silence for the victims.

AUS vs SA Live Score, WTC Final 2025 Day 3: Australian tail frustrate SAAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, World Test Championship Final 2025 Updates: The match is on a knife edge at the moment as Australia's tailenders look to frustrate South Africa and increase the lead further at Lord's. The Proteas are on the cusp of a monumental win but will need to get the two remaining wickets quickly.

England tour: Coach Gautam Gambhir returns to India due to family emergencyIndian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir has returned to India from England due to a family emergency. India and England are set to lock horns in a five-match Test series beginning from June 20.

Cummins hungry for more after 300 Test wickets: Got lots of miles in my legsAfter breaking into the 300 Test wicket club, Australia's Test skipper Pat Cummins remains hungry for more honours in his career. Cummins picked up six wickets for 28 on Day 2 of the WTC Final on Thursday, June 12.

Manchester United target Viktor Gyokeres breaks silence amidst Sporting standoffViktor Gyokeres has addressed rumours about his future amidst a reported stand-off with Sporting Lisbon. Gyokeres has been heavily linked with a move to Manchester United and Arsenal during the summer.

Shubman Gill will bat with more responsibility as captain, claims former spinnerIndia's newly appointed Test captain Shubman Gill has been backed to bat a lot more responsibly with the added burden of leadership on his shoulders by former England spinner Monty Panesar.

India bowling coach Morne Morkel admits he was nervous ahead of England tourIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel felt nervous going into the England tour due to the limited red-ball game time the team has had in the past few months. India last played a Test match in January this year.

Match can go either way, but we've a lot of belief in dressing room: BedinghamSouth Africa batter David Bedingham said that the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 hangs in the balance on Day 2, but mentioned that there's enough belief in the dressing room to chase down whatever Australia puts on the board. Australia finished Day 2 on 144/8, leading by 218 runs in their second innings.

Cummins-Hazlewood-Starc better than McGrath-Lee-Gillespie: Hayden's big claimMatthew Hayden has praised the current Australian pace trio of Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Mitchell Starc after their dominant Day 2 performance in the World Test Championship final. Hayden feels that the trio is better than the pace attack of Glenn McGrath, Jason Gillespie and Glenn McGrath.

Finn Allen shatters multiple records en route 51-ball 151 for San FranciscoNew Zealand batter Finn Allen rewrote the record books with his breathtaking innings of 151 (51) during the opening game of Major League Cricket 2025 (MLC 2025) for San Francisco Unicorns.

Shubman Gill will bat with more responsibility as captain, claims former spinnerIndia's newly appointed Test captain Shubman Gill has been backed to bat a lot more responsibly with the added burden of leadership on his shoulders by former England spinner Monty Panesar.

India bowling coach Morne Morkel admits he was nervous ahead of England tourIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel felt nervous going into the England tour due to the limited red-ball game time the team has had in the past few months. India last played a Test match in January this year.

Australia finished Day 2 on 144/8, leading by 218 runs in their second innings.

Hayden feels that the trio is better than the pace attack of Glenn McGrath, Jason Gillespie and Glenn McGrath.

Finn Allen shatters multiple records en route 51-ball 151 for San FranciscoNew Zealand batter Finn Allen rewrote the record books with his breathtaking innings of 151 (51) during the opening game of Major League Cricket 2025 (MLC 2025) for San Francisco Unicorns.

Tottenham Hotspur announce Thomas Frank as Ange Postecoglou replacementTottenham Hotspur have appointed Thomas Frank as their new manager on a three-year contract. The Danish coach replaces Ange Postecoglou after a disappointing Premier League season, that saw Spurs finish 17th in the points table.

SA excited about being on threshold of becoming WTC winners: David BedinghamSouth Africa batter David Bedingham said that the team is excited about being on the cusp of winning the World Test Championship (WTC) title. South Africa will have to chase down a target in excess of 200 to stake claim of the coveted mace.

Was never loved like Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal: Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic has claimed that he was never loved like Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal during their playing days and felt like the third guy in tennis. Djokovic shared legendary rivalries with both Federer and Nadal.

Diya Chitale: The tiny titan of Indian table tennis dreamsDabang Delhi's Diya Chitale believes that India have a proper shot at a table tennis medal at the LA Olympics. India Today spoke to her on the sidelines of Ultimate Table Tennis where she opened up on her journey and the growing Indian TT scene.

Happy to get a lead of 200, hopefully we get another 20 or 30 tomorrow: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that he was delighted with his team crossing the 200-run lead in the second innings of the World Test Championship (WTC) final against South Africa. Australia finished Day 2 at 144/8, leading by 218 runs at the end of the day's play.

India vs India A in 4-day intra-squad game in Beckenham: Will it be streamed live?India will finalise their preparation for the all-important five-match Test series against England, through a 4-day intra-squad warm-up fixture against India A. However, the match will not be live-streamed for fans.

Did Australia withdraw appeal against David Bedingham in WTC final? Cummins revealsAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that they would've withdrawn the appeal against David Bedingham for handling the ball, if the umpires didn't signal dead ball on Day 2 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against South Africa.

From IPL 2025 to T20 Mumbai: Shreyas Iyer endures back-to-back final heartbreaksT20 Mumbai League 2025: Shreyas Iyer endured a second heartbreak in June as his side, SoBo Mumbai Falcons, lost the final of the inaugural edition of the T20 tournament in Mumbai. On June 3, Shreyas's Punjab Kings lost to RCB in the IPL final.

Happy to get a lead of 200, hopefully we get another 20 or 30 tomorrow: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that he was delighted with his team crossing the 200-run lead in the second innings of the World Test Championship (WTC) final against South Africa. Australia finished Day 2 at 144/8, leading by 218 runs at the end of the day's play.

India vs India A in 4-day intra-squad game in Beckenham: Will it be streamed live?India will finalise their preparation for the all-important five-match Test series against England, through a 4-day intra-squad warm-up fixture against India A. However, the match will not be live-streamed for fans.

Did Australia withdraw appeal against David Bedingham in WTC final? Cummins revealsAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that they would've withdrawn the appeal against David Bedingham for handling the ball, if the umpires didn't signal dead ball on Day 2 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against South Africa.

From IPL 2025 to T20 Mumbai: Shreyas Iyer endures back-to-back final heartbreaksT20 Mumbai League 2025: Shreyas Iyer endured a second heartbreak in June as his side, SoBo Mumbai Falcons, lost the final of the inaugural edition of the T20 tournament in Mumbai. On June 3, Shreyas's Punjab Kings lost to RCB in the IPL final.

UTT Season 6: U Mumba qualify for semifinals, end Dabang Delhi's unbeaten streakU Mumba TT clinched the last available semi-final berth in Ultimate Table Tennis (UTT) Season 6 after defeating Dabang Delhi TTC 10-5 in a crucial match held in Ahmedabad on Thursday.

South Africa well-placed in WTC final: Ngidi confident despite 218-run deficitLungi Ngidi was confident that South Africa's bowlers could finish the job early on the third day, removing the final two Australian wickets and keeping the target below 230—a total he believes would give the Proteas a genuine chance of winning their first World Test Championship title.

WTC final on a knife's edge as Australia, South Africa trade blows on Day 2WTC 2025 final, SA vs AUS: Alex Carey chipped in with a crucial 43 to rescue Australia from 73 for 7 and help them finish with 144 for 8 at Stumps on Day 2. 28 wickets have fallen in the first two days of the big final at Lord's and Australia have their noses ahead, only by a small margin.

Players observe silence in Mumbai T20 final to mourn Air India plane crash victimsMumbai T20 League 2025 final: Players from both the SoBo Mumbai Falcons and the Mumbai South Central Maratha Royals observed a one-minute silence to mourn the victims of the tragic Air India plane crash.

Kevin De Bruyne joins Napoli on free transfer after leaving Manchester CitySerie A champions Napoli have confirmed the signing of Kevin De Bruyne on a free transfer following his exit from Manchester City at the end of his contract.

Pakistan in talks with Afghanistan for tri-series if Asia Cup is postponedThe Pakistan Cricket Board is negotiating a tri-series with Afghanistan and UAE amid doubts over the Asia Cup in India. India have the hosting rights for the continental tournament, scheduled to be held later this year.

Pakistan sideline Babar Azam, Muhammad Rizwan, Shaheen Afridi from T20 plansThe Pakistan selectors have decided to exclude senior players such as Babar Azam, Muhammad Rizwan, and Shaheen Shah Afridi from the upcoming T20 series against the West Indies and Bangladesh.

Watch: Pat Cummins collides with Kyle Verreynne before taking a successful reviewWTC Final, Australia vs South Africa: Pat Cummins collided with Kyle Verreynne during a dramatic LBW appeal, but that didn't stop the Australian skipper from going for the DRS — which ultimately resulted in the wicket.

Mehidy Hasan Miraz named Bangladesh ODI captain for 12 monthsMehidy Hasan Miraz has replaced Najmul Hossain Shanto as Bangladesh's new ODI captain "for the next 12 months". Miraz has previously captained Bangladesh in four ODIs in Shanto's absence.

Matheus Cunha reveals childhood Manchester United dream after big-money transferMatheus Cunha has completed his dream move to Manchester United from Wolves in a £63 million deal. The Brazil forward aims to help United recover after a disappointing Premier League season.

Pat Cummins scripts world record, 1st captain to take 5-wicket haul in ICC finalPat Cummins made history by taking a five-wicket haul in the ICC World Test Championship final against South Africa at Lord's. He went past India's Bishan Singh Bedi in an all-time list of captains with most five-fers in Test cricket history.

Out or not out? David Bedingham survives the handle-the-ball appeal in WTC finalSouth Africa batter David Bedingham found himself in the middle of a rare on-field controversy during the World Test Championship final against Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
